articles.description: All the latest football news and weekend reaction as Arsenal beat rivals Tottenham and Newcastle won at Wolves, plus Phil McNulty Q&A to come.
articles.title: Football latest: Premier League reaction as Arsenal and Newcastle win to stay unbeaten

articles.description: World Athletics president Lord Coe has been named as one of seven confirmed candidates to succeed Thomas Bach as  International Olympic Committee (IOC) president.
articles.title: Lord Coe among seven candidates to be new IOC president

articles.description: We pick out 25 players outside the Premier League you could watch this season, as the Champions League comes to the BBC.
articles.title: Champions League: Mbappe, Bellingham among players to watch this season

articles.description: A Sunday of upsets saw the Saints batter the Cowboys, Raiders stun the Ravens and Vikings stifle the 49ers.
articles.title: NFL results & Week Two recap: Ravens, Cowboys & 49ers stunned by Raiders, Saints, Vikings

articles.description: England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker James Anderson is a target for Major League Cricket in the USA, BBC Sport understands.
articles.title: James Anderson: Major League Cricket in USA keen on England icon

articles.description: Arsenal's attention to detail at set-pieces exposes Tottenham's greatest weakness yet again, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Tottenham 0-1 Arsenal: Gabriel & Gunners expose Spurs' set-piece flaws

articles.description: Captain Suzann Pettersen says she does not “have any regrets” as Europe fall to a 15½-12½ defeat to the United States and relinquish their five-year hold on the Solheim Cup.
articles.title: Solheim Cup: Captain Suzann Pettersen has no 'regrets' after Europe lose to the United States

articles.description: After starting the 2023 season with one of the slowest cars, McLaren celebrate a "huge milestone" by taking over a constructors' championship leaders.
articles.title: Azerbaijan GP 2024: 'McLaren's constructors' lead over Red Bull seismic'

articles.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?
articles.title: Troy Deeney's Team of the Week: Haaland, Watkins, Caicedo, Gabriel and more

articles.description: The hearing into Manchester City's 115 charges for alleged breaches of the Premier League's financial rules begins on Monday.
articles.title: Man City hearing: Premier League 115 charges case begins
